definition: variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: But it still did not put an end to his shivering.
sentences.chinese: 可是他冷顫還是打個不停。

sentences.english: A good ice, good cold, I can not help I called chills.
sentences.chinese: 好冰，好涼，我不禁打了個冷顫。

sentences.english: From the darting blurs I hear an ominous whistling that chills my soul.
sentences.chinese: 從投擲的迷離我聽見一不祥吹口哨冷顫我的靈魂。

sentences.english: The sound of a dentist's drill always sets my teeth on edge.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見牙醫鑽牙的聲音就打冷顫。

sentences.english: She immediately beat one cold Zhan, the fowl skin pimples all got up.
sentences.chinese: 她頓時打了個冷顫，雞皮疙瘩都起來了。
一個冷顫突然覺得害怕。

sentences.english: Armon shivered as he and Dagen crossed the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 在他們走在橋上時，艾蒙打了一個冷顫。

sentences.english: "Whataboutism" was a favourite tactic of Soviet propagandists during the old Cold War.
sentences.chinese: 曾經是蘇聯宣導者在冷顫時期最愛用的策略。

sentences.english: A shiver ran down her back.
sentences.chinese: 她的脊背打了一個冷顫。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
